refnamediv.refpurpose: trees of data with any number of branches.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GNode struct and its associated functions provide a N-ary tree data structure, where nodes in the tree can contain arbitrary data.
To create a new tree use g_node_new().
To insert a node into a tree use g_node_insert(), g_node_insert_before(), g_node_append() and g_node_prepend().
To create a new node and insert it into a tree use g_node_insert_data(), g_node_insert_data_before(), g_node_append_data() and g_node_prepend_data().
To reverse the children of a node use g_node_reverse_children().

To find a node use g_node_get_root(), g_node_find(), g_node_find_child(), g_node_child_index(), g_node_child_position(), g_node_first_child(), g_node_last_child(), g_node_nth_child(), g_node_first_sibling(), g_node_prev_sibling(), g_node_next_sibling() or g_node_last_sibling().
To get information about a node or tree use G_NODE_IS_LEAF(), G_NODE_IS_ROOT(), g_node_depth(), g_node_n_nodes(), g_node_n_children(), g_node_is_ancestor() or g_node_max_height().
To traverse a tree, calling a function for each node visited in the traversal, use g_node_traverse() or g_node_children_foreach().
To remove a node or subtree from a tree use g_node_unlink() or g_node_destroy().

refsect2.title: struct GNode
refsect2.para: The GNode struct represents one node in a N-ary Tree. The data field contains the actual data of the node. The next and prev fields point to the node's siblings (a sibling is another GNode with the same parent). The parent field points to the parent of the GNode, or is NULL if the GNode is the root of the tree. The children field points to the first child of the GNode. The other children are accessed by using the next pointer of each child.

refsect2.title: g_node_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GNode containing the given data. Used to create the first node in a tree.

listitem.simpara: the data of the new node.
a new GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_copy ()
refsect2.para: Recursively copies a GNode (but does not deep-copy the data inside the nodes, see g_node_copy_deep() if you need that).

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
a new GNode containing the same data pointers.

refsect2.title: GCopyFunc ()
refsect2.para: A function of this signature is used to copy the node data when doing a deep-copy of a tree.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the data which should be copied.
Additional data.
A pointer to the copy.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_node_copy_deep ()
refsect2.para: Recursively copies a GNode and its data.

listitem.simpara: a GNode
the function which is called to copy the data inside each node, or NULL to use the original data.
data to pass to copy_func
a new GNode containing copies of the data in node.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_node_insert ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a GNode beneath the parent at the given position.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place node under.
the position to place node at, with respect to its siblings. If position is -1, node is inserted as the last child of parent.
the GNode to insert.
the inserted GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_insert_before ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a GNode beneath the parent before the given sibling.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place node under.
the sibling GNode to place node before. If sibling is NULL, the node is inserted as the last child of parent.
the GNode to insert.
the inserted GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_insert_after ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a GNode beneath the parent after the given sibling.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place node under.
the sibling GNode to place node after. If sibling is NULL, the node is inserted as the first child of parent.
the GNode to insert.
the inserted GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_append()
refsect2.para: Inserts a GNode as the last child of the given parent.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place the new GNode under.
the GNode to insert.
the inserted GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_prepend ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a GNode as the first child of the given parent.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place the new GNode under.
the GNode to insert.
the inserted GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_insert_data()
refsect2.para: Inserts a new GNode at the given position.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place the new GNode under.
the position to place the new GNode at. If position is -1, the new GNode is inserted as the last child of parent.
the data for the new GNode.
the new GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_insert_data_before()
refsect2.para: Inserts a new GNode before the given sibling.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place the new GNode under.
the sibling GNode to place the new GNode before.
the data for the new GNode.
the new GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_append_data()
refsect2.para: Inserts a new GNode as the last child of the given parent.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place the new GNode under.
the data for the new GNode.
the new GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_prepend_data()
refsect2.para: Inserts a new GNode as the first child of the given parent.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to place the new GNode under.
the data for the new GNode.
the new GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_reverse_children ()
refsect2.para: Reverses the order of the children of a GNode. (It doesn't change the order of the grandchildren.)

listitem.simpara: a GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_traverse ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_node_traverse (GNode *root, GTraverseType order, GTraverseFlags flags, gint max_depth, GNodeTraverseFunc func, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Traverses a tree starting at the given root GNode. It calls the given function for each node visited. The traversal can be halted at any point by returning TRUE from func.

listitem.simpara: the root GNode of the tree to traverse.
the order in which nodes are visited - G_IN_ORDER, G_PRE_ORDER, G_POST_ORDER, or G_LEVEL_ORDER.
which types of children are to be visited, one of G_TRAVERSE_ALL, G_TRAVERSE_LEAFS and G_TRAVERSE_NON_LEAFS.

the maximum depth of the traversal. Nodes below this depth will not be visited. If max_depth is -1 all nodes in the tree are visited. If depth is 1, only the root is visited. If depth is 2, the root and its children are visited. And so on.
the function to call for each visited GNode.
user data to pass to the function.

refsect2.title: enum GTraverseFlags
refsect2.para: Specifies which nodes are visited during several of the tree functions, including g_node_traverse() and g_node_find().

listitem.simpara: only leaf nodes should be visited.
only non-leaf nodes should be visited.
all nodes should be visited.

refsect2.title: GNodeTraverseFunc ()
refsect2.para: Specifies the type of function passed to g_node_traverse(). The function is called with each of the nodes visited, together with the user data passed to g_node_traverse(). If the function returns TRUE, then the traversal is stopped.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
user data passed to g_node_traverse().
TRUE to stop the traversal.

refsect2.title: g_node_children_foreach ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_node_children_foreach (GNode *node, GTraverseFlags flags, GNodeForeachFunc func, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Calls a function for each of the children of a GNode. Note that it doesn't descend beneath the child nodes.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
which types of children are to be visited, one of G_TRAVERSE_ALL, G_TRAVERSE_LEAFS and G_TRAVERSE_NON_LEAFS.
the function to call for each visited node.
user data to pass to the function.

refsect2.title: GNodeForeachFunc ()
refsect2.para: Specifies the type of function passed to g_node_children_foreach(). The function is called with each child node, together with the user data passed to g_node_children_foreach().

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
user data passed to g_node_children_foreach().

refsect2.title: g_node_get_root ()
refsect2.para: Gets the root of a tree.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the root of the tree.

refsect2.title: g_node_find ()
refsect2.programlisting: GNode* g_node_find (GNode *root, GTraverseType order, GTraverseFlags flags, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Finds a GNode in a tree.

listitem.simpara: the root GNode of the tree to search.
the order in which nodes are visited - G_IN_ORDER, G_PRE_ORDER, G_POST_ORDER, or G_LEVEL_ORDER.
which types of children are to be searched, one of G_TRAVERSE_ALL, G_TRAVERSE_LEAFS and G_TRAVERSE_NON_LEAFS.
the data to find.
the found GNode, or NULL if the data is not found.

refsect2.title: g_node_find_child ()
refsect2.para: Finds the first child of a GNode with the given data.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
which types of children are to be searched, one of G_TRAVERSE_ALL, G_TRAVERSE_LEAFS and G_TRAVERSE_NON_LEAFS.
the data to find.
the found child GNode, or NULL if the data is not found.

refsect2.title: g_node_child_index ()
refsect2.para: Gets the position of the first child of a GNode which contains the given data.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the data to find.
the index of the child of node which contains data, or -1 if the data is not found.

refsect2.title: g_node_child_position ()
refsect2.para: Gets the position of a GNode with respect to its siblings. child must be a child of node. The first child is numbered 0, the second 1, and so on.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
a child of node.
the position of child with respect to its siblings.

refsect2.title: g_node_first_child()
refsect2.para: Gets the first child of a GNode.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the last child of node, or NULL if node is NULL or has no children.

refsect2.title: g_node_last_child ()
refsect2.para: Gets the last child of a GNode.

listitem.simpara: a GNode (must not be NULL).
the last child of node, or NULL if node has no children.

refsect2.title: g_node_nth_child ()
refsect2.para: Gets a child of a GNode, using the given index. The first child is at index 0. If the index is too big, NULL is returned.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the index of the desired child.
the child of node at index n.

refsect2.title: g_node_first_sibling ()
refsect2.para: Gets the first sibling of a GNode. This could possibly be the node itself.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the first sibling of node.

refsect2.title: g_node_next_sibling()
refsect2.para: Gets the next sibling of a GNode.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the next sibling of node, or NULL if node is NULL.

refsect2.title: g_node_prev_sibling()
refsect2.para: Gets the previous sibling of a GNode.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the previous sibling of node, or NULL if node is NULL.

refsect2.title: g_node_last_sibling ()
refsect2.para: Gets the last sibling of a GNode. This could possibly be the node itself.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the last sibling of node.

refsect2.title: G_NODE_IS_LEAF()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if a GNode is a leaf node.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
TRUE if the GNode is a leaf node (i.e. it has no children).

refsect2.title: G_NODE_IS_ROOT()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if a GNode is the root of a tree.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
TRUE if the GNode is the root of a tree (i.e. it has no parent or siblings).

refsect2.title: g_node_depth ()
refsect2.para: Gets the depth of a GNode.
If node is NULL the depth is 0. The root node has a depth of 1. For the children of the root node the depth is 2. And so on.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the depth of the GNode.

refsect2.title: g_node_n_nodes ()
refsect2.para: Gets the number of nodes in a tree.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
which types of children are to be counted, one of G_TRAVERSE_ALL, G_TRAVERSE_LEAFS and G_TRAVERSE_NON_LEAFS.
the number of nodes in the tree.

refsect2.title: g_node_n_children ()
refsect2.para: Gets the number of children of a GNode.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the number of children of node.

refsect2.title: g_node_is_ancestor ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if node is an ancestor of descendant. This is true if node is the parent of descendant, or if node is the grandparent of descendant etc.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
a GNode.
TRUE if node is an ancestor of descendant.

refsect2.title: g_node_max_height ()
refsect2.para: Gets the maximum height of all branches beneath a GNode. This is the maximum distance from the GNode to all leaf nodes.
If root is NULL, 0 is returned. If root has no children, 1 is returned. If root has children, 2 is returned. And so on.

listitem.simpara: a GNode.
the maximum height of the tree beneath root.

refsect2.title: g_node_unlink ()
refsect2.para: Unlinks a GNode from a tree, resulting in two separate trees.

listitem.simpara: the GNode to unlink, which becomes the root of a new tree.

refsect2.title: g_node_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Removes the GNode and its children from the tree, freeing any memory allocated.

listitem.simpara: the root of the tree/subtree to destroy.

refsect2.title: g_node_push_allocator ()
refsect2.para: Sets the allocator to use to allocate GNode elements. Use g_node_pop_allocator() to restore the previous allocator.

listitem.simpara: the GAllocator to use when allocating GNode elements.

refsect2.title: g_node_pop_allocator ()
refsect2.para: Restores the previous GAllocator, used when allocating GNode elements.
